intro: Phyllorkis incurva, commonly known as the curved phyllorkis, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, curving leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
